our_story.title: Our Story
story: In 2019, while traveling in New Zealand, Alex met someone who would eventually lead him to Germany — and to Madeline. What started as a spontaneous visit turned into something much more.

They kept in touch across time zones, voice messages turning into plans, and eventually, a return trip to see each other again. A road trip through Austria sealed the deal — they knew they had something real.

From the Canadian prairies to small-town Germany, through freezing winters and pandemic delays, they made it work. Now, after years of long-distance and adventure, they’re finally ready to start the next chapter — together.
our_story.quote: True love is like wildflowers... it’s often found in the most unlikely places.

reception.title: Reception
reception.time: 2:30 PM – until the last one standing
reception.description: Join us for dinner, dancing, and celebration in a tent near the ceremony site. The surrounding area will be open for guests to enjoy outdoor games and socializing. Cocktail hour will begin immediately after the ceremony. More information about the venue can be found at

paulushaus.description: Group house, ideal for larger self-catering groups. Kitchen, outdoor area with sports/playground, basic amenities. No restaurant. ~0 km to the venue; ~4 km to the city center. Free parking.
paulushaus.info: The venue is 4 km outside the city, so transportation is needed to get there and back. Taxis are available if you don’t rent a car. When possible, we’ll also try to help arrange transport—either through friends, family, or ourselves.
paulushaus.note_accommodation: Please note: Accommodations at the venue are limited and will be reserved on a first-come, first-served basis. If you'd like to stay at the venue, please contact us to arrange lodging directly. These accommodations are included in our venue costs, so we do not expect any payment from our guests. However, if you feel inclined to support our celebration, you’re welcome to make a donation — though this is entirely optional and deeply appreciated.

hotelRemspark.description: Modern 4-star hotel near the city center. Fitness area, rooftop restaurant/bar, breakfast buffet. ~7–8 km to the venue. Paid parking on-site. Bike rental available for a fee, and Wi-Fi included.

hotelSchwaebischGmuend.description: Comfortable 4-star hotel with wellness area (pool, sauna, fitness), breakfast buffet, and regional cuisine. ~6–7 km to the venue. Underground parking (~€10/day). Located right at the train station.

schoenblick.description: Quiet guesthouse near the forest. Breakfast included, basic amenities, park area, and free parking. ~1–2 km to the venue; ~2.5 km to the city center.

mutlangerHof.description: Simple and quiet guesthouse in Mutlangen. Free Wi-Fi, continental breakfast, and bike rental. ~5 km to the venue; ~3.5 km to the city center. Free parking on-site.

arrivingInGermany.title: Arriving in Germany
arrivingInGermany.content:
Fly into one of these airports:

• Stuttgart Airport (STR) – Closest to where we live (~50 km from Schwäbisch Gmünd)
• Frankfurt Airport (FRA) – Larger international hub (~250 km from Schwäbisch Gmünd)
• Munich Airport (MUC) – Another option (~215 km from Schwäbisch Gmünd)

gettingToGmuend.title: Getting to Schwäbisch Gmünd
gettingToGmuend.content:
• From Stuttgart Airport: Train approx. 45 min; Car rental approx. 50 minutes.
• From Frankfurt Airport: Train approx. 3-4 hours (Will need to transfer in Stuttgart); Car rental approx. 3 hours.
• From Munich Airport: Train approx. 3 hours; Car rental approx. 2.5 hours.

gettingToVenue.title: Getting to the Venue
gettingToVenue.content:
From Schwäbisch Gmünd to the venue is approx. 10 km.

We recommend taking a taxi if you are not staying at the venue. We will also try to organize transport with friends and family for you when possible.

activities.title: Things to Do Around Schwäbisch Gmünd
activities.subtitle: Whether you're staying a few days or a couple of weeks, there's something here for everyone.

explore.title: Explore Schwäbisch Gmünd
explore.desc: Discover cobbled streets, cafés, and the Holy Cross Minster.

riverwalk.title: Stadtgarten & Rems River Walk
riverwalk.desc: Relaxing green spaces right in town.

skypark.title: Sky Park
skypark.desc: A fun treetop climbing experience for all ages.

museum.title: Museum im Prediger
museum.desc: Art and local culture inside a historic monastery.

food.title: Swabian Cuisine
food.desc: Try Maultaschen, Spätzle, and local beer at a traditional restaurant.

days_7.title: 🗓️ If You're Staying for a Week

hike.title: Hike Hohenstaufen
hike.desc: Beautiful views and castle ruins nearby.

limes.title: Aalen’s Limes Museum
limes.desc: Dive into Roman history just 30 mins away.

hall.title: Schwäbisch Hall
hall.desc: Day trip to a storybook town with half-timbered houses.

therme.title: Thermal Baths
therme.desc: Unwind at Limes-Therme or Adelindis Therme.

nature.title: Remstal Nature
nature.desc: Bike or hike scenic valleys and trails.

stuttgart.title: Stuttgart
stuttgart.desc: Visit the Mercedes-Benz Museum, the zoo, or Königstraße for shopping.

castles.title: Castle Tour
castles.desc: Explore Hohenzollern, Lichtenstein, or Ludwigsburg castles.

blackforest.title: Black Forest
blackforest.desc: Scenic drives, hikes, and villages like Triberg or Titisee.

bodensee.title: Lake Constance (Bodensee)
bodensee.desc: Visit Meersburg, Lindau, or take a ferry to Mainau Island.

ulm.title: Ulm
ulm.desc: Climb the tallest church in the world and stroll along the Danube.

allgaeu.title: Allgäu Region
allgaeu.desc: Discover rolling green hills, Alpine views, and traditional Bavarian charm.

neuschwanstein.title: Neuschwanstein Castle
neuschwanstein.desc: A fairytale castle near Füssen — one of Germany’s most iconic sights.

munich.title: Munich (München)
munich.desc: Visit the capital of Bavaria for beer gardens, museums, English Garden, and a vibrant city vibe.
